
---

<!-- WARNING: this file was generated by Pulumi Docs Generator. -->
<!-- Do not edit by hand unless you're certain you know what you are doing! -->

Use this data source to get the [WAF rules](https://developer.fastly.com/reference/api/waf/rules/) of Fastly. A set of third-party rules from the OWASP Core Ruleset, commercial sources, and open source, in addition to Fastly-generated rules.
They offer protection from injection attacks and cross site scripting amongst other key application-layer attacks.


{{% examples %}}

## Example Usage

{{< chooser language "typescript,python,go,csharp" / >}}





{{< example csharp >}}

```csharp
using Pulumi;
using Fastly = Pulumi.Fastly;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var owasp = Output.Create(Fastly.GetWafRules.InvokeAsync(new Fastly.GetWafRulesArgs
        {
            Publishers = 
            {
                "owasp",
            },
        }));
    }

}
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example go >}}

```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-fastly/sdk/v3/go/fastly"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := fastly.GetWafRules(ctx, &GetWafRulesArgs{
			Publishers: []string{
				"owasp",
			},
		}, nil)
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example python >}}

```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_fastly as fastly

owasp = fastly.get_waf_rules(publishers=["owasp"])
```


{{< /example >}}


{{< example typescript >}}


```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as fastly from "@pulumi/fastly";

const owasp = pulumi.output(fastly.getWafRules({
    publishers: ["owasp"],
}));
```

## Using getWafRules {#using}

Two invocation forms are available. The direct form accepts plain
arguments and either blocks until the result value is available, or
returns a Promise-wrapped result. The output form accepts
Input-wrapped arguments and returns an Output-wrapped result.

    </dt>

{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="type_go">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The rule's type.
{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}
